The city and surrounding areas have faced persistent rainfall and waterlogging for the past few days. The IMD has forecast continued very heavy rain across Chennai, Tiruvallur, Chengalpattu, and Kancheepuram districts. University of Madras exams have been postponed, transport is disrupted, and cultural events in Tiruvannamalai continue amid flooding.

description: India and Russia are set to discuss advanced BrahMos missile development during President Putin's visit.  Following its success in Operation Sindoor, India seeks lighter, versatile BrahMos-NG variants for its Air Force and extended-range systems.  This collaboration underscores the strong Indo-Russian strategic partnership, with further talks on next-gen hypersonic and air-to-air missiles also anticipated.

title: Tension at Bhopal tragedy rally: BJP alleges plan to burn RSS effigy; police intervene
description: A Bhopal gas tragedy commemoration rally turned contentious as BJP supporters alleged protesters intended to burn an RSS effigy alongside one representing Dow Chemical. Police intervened, removing the effigy after a complaint, citing it was offensive and warning against targeting any organisation. Survivor groups denied the accusation, stating effigies represented those responsible for the disaster.

title: 1 post a minute: Trump's manic 'Truths' raise eyebrows; what did he say
description: President Trump unleashed over 160 posts on Truth Social in a late-night digital barrage, questioning his governing priorities and mental acuity. The frenetic output, exceeding one post per minute, included political attacks, conspiracy claims, and boasts, followed by a cabinet meeting where he appeared to nod off.

title: AI psychosis: Inside eerie trend of AI dependence — and why it's dangerous
description: AI assistants are evolving from tools to emotional anchors, with people forming deep, private bonds with chatbots as therapists and friends. This reliance, driven by immediacy and comfort, blurs lines between reality and imagination, leading to potential emotional dependency and even 'AI psychosis.' While AI offers a low-effort outlet for unfiltered conversations, experts warn it cannot replace genuine human connection and empathy, highlighting the profound impact on our emotional landscapes.

description: IndiGo has apologised for widespread flight disruptions over the past two days. The airline cited a combination of technical glitches, winter schedule changes, bad weather, airport congestion, and new crew rostering rules. To address the situation, IndiGo has adjusted its flight schedules for the next 48 hours. Affected passengers are being offered alternative flights or refunds.

title: Over 72,000 foreign students study in India from 200 countries: Centre tells Rajya Sabha
Bengaluru beats Delhi, Mumbai, Hyderabad as India’s ‘best food city’, Scottish travel vlogger calls its breakfast ‘out of this world’

BJP’s Dinesh Sharma seeks to rename roads in Delhi bearing Mughal, British-era names: ‘Showcases colonial mindset’
IND vs SA: Shubman Gill gets vice-captain role for T20Is — with one major BCCI condition
description: Shubman Gill has been named Suryakumar Yadav's deputy for the upcoming T20I series against South Africa, pending medical clearance. Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah also return to the 15-member squad. Rinku Singh has been omitted from the team that recently toured Australia. The series commences on December 9.

title: Mitchell Starc’s skills and Australia’s high winning percentage makes pink-ball Ashes Test a one-sided affair

Avengers Doomsday trailer coming out this month? What Avatar Fire and Ash has to do with it

Clippers cut Chris Paul: Team’s sudden statement reveals shocking decision
description: The Los Angeles Clippers announced they are parting ways with veteran guard Chris Paul, just weeks into the 2025-2026 season. This decision came after Paul posted a cryptic Instagram story about being sent home. The team's statement clarified the departure, emphasizing that Paul is not to blame for their struggles and expressing gratitude for his contributions.

New look, new colours: Team India's T20 World Cup 2026 jersey revealed
description: The jersey was unveiled by former India captain Rohit Sharma who is also the brand ambassador of the tournament, and member of the Indian T20 side Tilak Varma. The upcoming T20 World Cup will be co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka and is set to begin on February 7, with the final scheduled for March 8. Suryakumar Yadav and his team will kick off their campaign against the USA on February 7 in Mumbai.

title: IND vs SA: BCCI announces India's 15-man squad for South Africa T20Is; Gill included with a twist
description: Suryakumar Yadav will captain India's T20I squad against South Africa, with Shubman Gill named vice-captain pending fitness. The team features a strong batting lineup including Abhishek Sharma and Hardik Pandya, alongside versatile all-rounders and a balanced bowling attack led by Jasprit Bumrah and spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakaravarthy.

Anushka's adorable reaction to Virat Kohli's 53rd ODI century goes viral — See post
description: Virat Kohli smashed his 53rd ODI century, a remarkable 102, in India's second match against South Africa. This century, his second consecutive of the series, propelled his international tally to 84 hundreds. He also set a new record for consecutive ODI centuries, surpassing AB de Villiers.

Perfect storm: Crew crunch cripples IndiGo, tech glitch adds to chaos; over 200 flights cancelled
description: IndiGo faced massive disruptions Wednesday, cancelling over 70 flights and causing widespread delays due to crew shortages following new duty norms, technology glitches, and airport congestion.  On-time performance plummeted, impacting thousands of passengers.  Airlines are working to restore normalcy, but a clear timeline remains uncertain.

RPSC ASO 2025 answer key released; objection window now open
description: The Rajasthan Public Service Commission has released the provisional answer key for the Assistant Statistical Officer exam. Candidates can now check their tentative scores and raise objections against any discrepancies. The window for submitting challenges, along with supporting documents and a fee, opens on December 4, 2025, and closes on December 6, 2025.

title: Rupee value plummets: Currency hits all-time low of 90.21 vs $; what's driving crash
description: The Indian Rupee hit a historic low on Wednesday, crossing the 90-per-dollar mark for the first time. This decline was driven by foreign fund outflows, rising crude oil prices, and uncertainty surrounding the India-US trade deal. Market watchers noted a lack of Reserve Bank of India intervention for much of the session.

title: ‘Only those should be considered minorities in India who are below 2% of population’: BJP MP

Crew crunch hits IndiGo: Over 200 flights cancelled; chaos at major airports
description: IndiGo is experiencing significant flight delays and cancellations, impacting nearly two out of three domestic passengers. This disruption stems from a critical crew shortage following the implementation of new flight duty time limitations. The airline, known for its punctuality, has seen its on-time performance plummet, causing widespread inconvenience during the peak travel season.

title: Salary stopped, struggled for food: Cameroon ordeal ends for 5 Jharkhand workers
No to Russian gas: EU aims to ban supply by 2027 - what's the plan?
description: The European Union has agreed to completely halt Russian gas imports by autumn 2027, ending new long-term pipeline contracts by September 30, 2027, and LNG deals by January 1, 2027. This move aims to enhance energy security and independence, with a roadmap also being drafted to eliminate Russian oil imports to Hungary and Slovakia by the same deadline.

title: NCR states to submit 2026 annual pollution action plans by year-end: Bhupender Yadav

Mumbai boy, 10, gained 10 kg in 5 months: Smartphone use before age 12 can lead to obesity, depression, says new study
Delhi’s pollution surge puts heart and diabetes patients at risk
description: In a dire report from Delhi, healthcare facilities have logged more than 200,000 cases of acute respiratory issues, predominantly threatening at-risk groups such as those with diabetes and heart ailments. The toxic smog is not just a nuisance; it intensifies pre-existing health conditions, causing rapid arterial narrowing and extra stress on the heart.

title: This species invades other colonies by making the community kill their ‘mother’
Harshit Rana reprimanded for breaching ICC Code of Conduct in first ODI against South Africa
'Pre-installation not mandatory': Govt rolls back Sanchar Saathi order
description: The government has withdrawn its mandate for mobile manufacturers to pre-install the Sanchar Saathi app on new smartphones. This decision follows concerns about privacy and surveillance, with the government clarifying the app's purpose is solely for citizen cybersecurity. The app's growing user acceptance has led to the voluntary installation option.

'Humanitarian grounds': SC allows deported pregnant woman to return from Bangladesh
description: The Supreme Court allowed a pregnant woman and her child to enter India on humanitarian grounds after their deportation to Bangladesh. The court directed the West Bengal government to provide care and medical support, including delivery, for the woman. This decision follows the Centre's challenge to a Calcutta High Court order that deemed the deportation illegal.

title: EC flags 47 lakh voter names for deletion in Bengal; probes three booths with ‘zero self-mapping’
‘Virat Kohli shouldn’t be forced to play Vijay Hazare Trophy, the quality isn’t high’: Former India batter questions domestic cricket push
HC directs Punjab to pay Rs 5 lakh to worker retrenched from hydel project in 1985: ‘State must act as model employer’
Delhi MCD bypolls: BJP sweeps major seats, AAP secures narrow wins; check full list of winners
description: The BJP secured a dominant victory in the Delhi Municipal Corporation bypolls, winning seven out of twelve wards. The AAP managed to win three seats, while the Congress and AIFB secured one each. This outcome is seen as a significant electoral test for the BJP following their recent rise to power in Delhi.

title: Putin's visit under Trump tariff shadow: What's at stake for India and Russia? Explained
description: Russian President Putin's India visit is crucial for trade dynamics amidst US pressure. India's energy security is now heavily reliant on discounted Russian crude, reshaping its procurement patterns. The visit aims to manage dependence in a fractured world, focusing on securing fuel, weapons, and payments.

title: Liver-friendly diet: 10 foods that boost liver health, reduce fat and improve function
description: Nourishing your liver is crucial for overall health, and diet plays a significant role. This article explores ten scientifically backed foods, including coffee, green tea, and fatty fish, that can help reduce inflammation, protect against fat accumulation, and improve liver enzymes. Incorporating these nutrient-dense options supports the liver's vital functions.

title: Cardi B shares sweet glimpse of newborn son, calls him her ‘cuddle buddy’
description: Cardi B is embracing motherhood again, sharing tender moments with her newborn son and boyfriend Stefon Diggs on Instagram. The rapper also offered glimpses of her other children, Kulture, Wave, and Blossom, highlighting the joys and realities of family life. This new chapter signifies personal growth and a continued commitment to her artistic career.

title: Drake London injury: Falcons coach breaks silence on recovery timeline
description: Atlanta Falcons head coach Raheem Morris provided an update on wide receiver Drake London's knee injury, stating he is "day-to-day" and "getting better" with a "chance" to play against the Seattle Seahawks. London has missed the last two games due to a PCL strain, with the team struggling in his absence.

title: Tech layoffs: IBM CEO says job cuts not due to AI; blames overhiring in Covid years
description: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna attributes current tech layoffs to pandemic-era over-hiring, not AI, calling it a "natural correction." While acknowledging AI will cause some job displacement, Krishna believes increased productivity will lead to new roles and overall hiring growth, particularly for college graduates.

title: Auston Matthews captaincy questioned as ex-Leafs GM says team picked wrong leader
description: Former executive Gord Stellick questions Auston Matthews' captaincy, suggesting leadership and talent are not synonymous. He believes the team lost its compass after the shift, with John Tavares' quiet professionalism now seen as a potential stabilizing force. The current leadership faces a critical test to steer the team back to resilience.

title: 'Clocking speed of 140 kmph': Influencer dies in horrific crash; named his bike 'Laila'
description: An 18-year-old died after losing control of his KTM sports bike near Surat's Breadliner Circle. Speeding and reportedly not wearing a helmet, Prince Patel crashed into the road divider, sustaining fatal head injuries. He was known for posting high-speed bike videos on social media.
